channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Hegseth reaffirms Vietnam partnership and hands over a leather box, belt and knife—wartime artifacts taken by U.S. soldiers
item.description: “Today we will exchange artifacts and information from the war with the goal of helping family members in both countries find peace.”

item.title: How this 3-person architecture firm designed the world’s largest museum
item.description: With more than 100,000 artifacts dating back thousands of years, nearly 900,000 square feet of floor space, a site that spans more than 120 acres, and...

item.title: Xi quips about backdoors during Xiaomi phone gift to Korea’s Lee
item.description: Xi, in South Korea to meet Trump on the sidelines of the APEC summit, presented the pair of smartphones to Korean President Lee Jae Myung.

item.title: How Companies Are Turning No-Hire, More-Fire Into a Growth Strategy
item.description: More companies are freezing or cutting headcounts, often with AI help, to build their business with fewer workers.

item.title: Exclusive: Airwallex crosses $1 billion in annualized revenue as fintech unicorn takes on U.S. competitors like Ramp and Stripe
item.description: Airwallex cofounder and CEO Jack Zhang says the company is growing 90% year-over-year after expanding into the U.S. and Europe.

item.title: Booking Holdings’s CEO Weathered the Dotcom Bubble. He Says the AI Boom is Different
item.description: Glenn Fogel says AI is already changing travel. He expects much more to come.

item.title: For now, data ignorance is bliss on Wall Street as investors are warned not to rely too heavily on private surveys
item.description: "The danger with this data is that its message will be given unwarranted credibility by the absence of proper economic data," said UBS's chief economi...

item.title: State Farm’s secret to making a boring company ‘break through’
item.description: Have you ever been to the Gamerhood? Part game show, part reality series, it recently wrapped its fourth season in August. Over five weekly episodes o...

item.title: You Need to Check Your Company’s Page on Grokipedia Right Now
item.description: Elon Musk’s new AI-powered Wikipedia competitor is prone to errors. Here’s how to request edits to your page.

item.title: Why statistics aren’t reflecting the economy and everyday American life
item.description: Below, Gene Ludwig shares five key insights from his new book, The Mismeasurement of America: How Outdated Government Statistics Mask the Economic Str...

item.title: Warren Buffett Is Sitting on a Record $347 Billion Cash Pile at Berkshire Hathaway
item.description: Berkshire reported record cash pile and earnings as Buffett prepares to retire.

item.title: Trump takes center stage at APEC–yet Asia’s business leaders are optimistic that multilateralism will prevail
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: The business impact of deepfakes
item.description: On May 19, 2023, a photograph appeared on what was then still called Twitter showing smoke billowing from the Pentagon after an apparent explosion. Th...

item.title: Jeff Bezos’ Secret to a Clear, Focused Mind Is Puttering. Psychology Says He’s on to Something
item.description: Puttering isn’t an aimless waste of time. It’s a powerful way to relax and reset your brain, according to Jeff Bezos and science.

item.title: Exclusive: Here are Custom and Border Protection’s rules for using AI
item.description: The Customs and Border Protection agency aims to establish a framework for the “strategic use of artificial intelligence ” and outline rules for ensur...
